title: Senator Kavanagh's Carpet Recycling Bill Signed Into Law - The New York State Senate
summary: New York has passed legislation requiring carpet manufacturers to create a program for collecting and recycling discarded and unused carpeting. The law aims to reduce waste, promote a circular economy, and decrease the presence of harmful PFAS chemicals in landfills. The legislation sets recycling performance goals and prohibits the sale of carpets containing hazardous PFAS materials after 2026.

title: Hundreds of undersized lobsters found in New York City supermarkets - SeafoodSource
summary: Authorities in the U.S. state of New York have discovered hundreds of undersized lobsters for sale in several New York City supermarkets. The lobsters were confiscated and donated to a food pantry in New York City. New York state law requires lobsters that are sold there to have a minimum carapace size of 3.375 inches and a maximum size of 5.25 inches.

title: Implementing circular economy and sustainability policies in Rwanda: Experiences of Rwandan manufacturers with the ... - Frontiers
summary: Despite the rise of plastic waste regulation and rising trends in the adoption of circular economy (CE) policies globally, investigations of their impact on businesses remain limited. This paper examines how the 10-R principles of CE feature in Rwanda's sustainability policies, and provides the experiences of Rwandan manufacturers following the implementation of the plastic ban.

title: Flipkart Launches ‘Flipkart Green’ for Customers Looking to Adopt a Sustainable Lifestyle - Indian Retailer
summary: Juicy Chemistry and Mommy Shots by Amrita have launched the 'Scars are Beautiful' campaign to celebrate the beauty of postpartum bodies and stretch marks. The campaign features 11 mothers proudly displaying their bodies and sharing their motherhood experiences to inspire other women to embrace their bodies and change societal perceptions.
